free: #e I am going to tell (the story) about my life.
#c 我來敘述我的一生。
#e My name is Tamih.
#c 我的名字是Tamih。
#e My father and mother named me Tamih.
#c Tamih的名字是我爸爸和媽媽給我取的。
#e My mother and father, who gave birth to me, said ‘you were born when we moved to this village.’
#c 生我的父母說，那時部落遷徙來到這個村落時生下你的，如此。
#e Now, I am 81 years old.
#c 所以，我現在的年齡，八十一歲。
#e I am almost 82 years old.
#c 我已經開始（進入）八十二歲。
#e I went to Chang-bin Elementary School here.
#c 我在長濱國小這裡唸小學。
#e After I graduated from elementary school, the elders said, ‘no one could take care of the cows.’
#c 到我結束小學學業，當時老人家說沒有人餵牛。
#e Thus, I stayed at home to take care of the cows.
#c 所以我一直在家餵牛。
#e I wanted to study.
#c 我想要念書。
#e But there were not enough people to help the elders; thus I became their helper.
#c 但老人家的人手不夠；所以我成為幫手。
#e When I grew up, there was a war between Japan and the US then.
#c 我稍微長大後，那時候日本和美國正在打仗。
#e I was garrisoned in the hill to take care of the soldiers who guarded the planes.
#c 我成為駐守在山丘駐守，照顧監視飛機的人。
#e If there were US planes, I would notify all the soldiers.
#c 假如有美國的飛機，我都會通知。
#e I stayed there for four years until the war was over.
#c 我在那裡四年，戰爭結束了。
#e Then I helped the elders with their work.
#c 我就幫忙老人家的工作。
#e My job was farming.
#c 我的工作是務農。
#e After the war of Japan was over, someone came to preach the words of God, to preach Christianity.
#c 那時日本的戰爭結束，有人來傳授神的話語，傳授基督教這樣子。
#e I was amazed by the preacher.
#c 對於那個傳授神的話語的人，我心裡很驚訝。
#e I believed in it. It was the truth, I thought.
#c 我相信了，最真的（道理）就是這個。我如此想。
#e During those two years, the preachers kept coming.
#c 這二年間那些宣教者不斷地來這。
#e My mind was enlightened.
#c 我的心頓悟了。
#e I firmly believed in it.
#c 我決心要相信。
#n ketun用在抽象地方表示決心。
#e From then on, a preacher called me to invite me to become a preacher.
#c 從那時，有傳教士打電話邀請我當傳教士。
#e If you want to study, you can study and become a preacher.
#c 如果你想念書，可以讀書，直到你成為傳教者，如是說。
#e I was eager (to be a preacher).
#c 我很期盼（變成一個傳教士）。
#e There was a shortage of workers at the farm, my father and mother grudgingly agreed.
#c 雖然農夫的生活非常不足，但是我的爸爸媽媽勉強答應。
#e Then I studied.
#c 然後我讀書。
#e After I graduated, there were many disciples.
#c 我畢業後，有很多信徒。
#e I became a teacher here, preaching.
#c 我成為老師在這裡宣教。
#e Not only here, I also went to Changbin and the port.
#c 不止這裡一處，還從長濱到大港口。
#e I kept preaching the words of God.
#c 我不斷走路宣揚神的話語。
#e There weren’t many preachers at that time.
#c 那個時候沒有很多傳教士。
#e I (preached) on my own, or with Fodo’ sometimes.
#c 我一個人（傳教），有時跟我的同伴Fodo’。
#e There were more and more (preachers) afterwards.
#c 後來傳教士就愈來愈多了。
#e And then we built a church here.
#c 不久之後我們在這裡蓋教會。
#e  Four years after we built the church, Turis, who was from the States, came here to learn Amis.
#c 我們建教會的第四年，有一個從美國來叫做Turis的人，來學習阿美語。
#e He found me and asked many (questions).
#c 他找到我，問我很多問題。
#e He had a companion, Urok; another was Tuana.
#c 他有同伴，像Urok，其次的同伴呢，有Tuana。
#e After he heard what I taught him, he found that it was different from what Urok and Tuana spoke.
#c 他發現不像Urok和Tuana（說的話），當他聽了我教他之後。
#e He grabbed hold of me.
#c 他抓住我。
#e You are my companion when I study Amis.
#c 你成為我學習阿美語的伴了。
#e Let us translate the Bible (into Amis).
#c 我們來翻譯聖經。
#e From then on, I started to accompany him.
#c 從那時起，我開始與他作伴。
#e Every week, I went to his house at Hsinkang so that he could study Amis with me.
#c 每個星期，我都去他新港的家作陪，陪他學阿美語。
#e And then we translated the Bible (into Amis).
#c 然後我們(開始)翻譯聖經。
#n fangcal-ay cutad聖經
#e At that time there was no written Amis, so there was no Amis Bible.
#c 那時還沒有阿美語的文字，（因此）還沒有（阿美語的）聖經。
#e After Turis came, I accompanied (him).
#c 從有Turis（來）之後，我陪著（他）。
#e Then we had written Amis.
#c 那時開始有了我們阿美族的文字。
#e (The written Amis) spread.
#c 到後來慢慢擴散。
#e The government did not approve of the use of the Roman alphabet.
#c 最當初的時候，政府不同意羅馬文字。
#e (So) we used Zhuyin symbols to transcribe Amis words.
#c (於是)阿美語文字是注音符號。
#n 目前沒有發現tu和itu的差別。
#e We learned Amis that way.
#c （我們）還用那樣子的文字學習。
#e From then on until I was 65, I took on the task of translating the Bible (into Amis).
#c 從那時候開始，一直到65歲，從事翻譯聖經的工作。
#e (After) Turis returned to the States, there was a new preacher, Afan.
#c Turis回美國後，有了一位新的宣教師，Afan。
#e Turis entrusted the task of Bible translation to Afan.
#c （之後）Turis把翻譯工作委託給Afan。
#e Afan and I translated the Bible together.
#c Afan成了我的同伴，翻譯（阿美）文字。
#e In retrospect, I spent thirty years developing a writing system for Amis.
#c 回憶當時，我三十年的工作，將阿美語文字化。
#e I thought if Turis hadn’t come, or if I had not liked his company, we would not have developed a writing system for Amis.
#c 我想，還好！如果Turis沒來，如果我不喜歡跟他作伴，我們就不會將阿美語文字化了。
#e I felt gratified.
#c 這是我心理所慶幸的。
#e Now (we) have written Amis.
#c 現在有文字了。
#e It is good that many people read the Bible.
#c 很好的是有很多人閱讀聖經。
#e Our speech was unified as we had a writing system.
#c 有了文字，話語就統一了。
#e At the time when there was no writing system of Amis, the Amis spoken in the south was different from that spoken in the central area.
#c 那時還沒有阿美文字的時候，阿美語南方的語言和中部不同。
#e Changbin is located in the middle.
#c 我們長濱在中間。
#e Now the Amis spoken in the central area is considered the standard speech.
#c 現在以中間的話作為我們的標準阿美語。
#e Our speech was unified after we had an Amis Bible.
#c 從有了聖經之後，話語統一了。
#e Both the north and south areas adopted the unified speech.
#c 北部的採用了，南部的也採用了這樣子的話語。
#e The Amis language was unified as there was a writing system.
#c 所以文字化了，阿美的話語合而為一。
#e We thank God for guiding us; that’s what I think.
#c 所以感謝，感謝神的引領，我是這樣想的。
#e I did not receive higher education because I only attended elementary school.
#c 我呢，我沒有讀到很高的學校，因為，我只有讀小學。
#e I like reading the Bible, which helped me learn about many things.
#c 我喜歡讀聖經，這使我了解任何事情。
#e Now I have retired.
#c 現在，我休息了。
#n 阿美語的休息是causative morpheme加上「呼吸」的的使役動詞。
#e I have been working for the church for fifty years, leading the church.
#c 我在教會工作，呃，五十年，帶領教會。
#e I retired when I was 75.
#c 我七十五歲時退休。
#e At that time I was resting; now I’m still resting.
#c 到那時候在休息，到現在還是在休息。
#e Although I have retired, I still help small churches here like those in Yongfu and Takumi.
#c 雖然我休息，我還是幫忙一些小教會，在永福和田組這裡。
#e I go to both churches in turn to help.
#c 我輪流去這二個教會幫忙。
#n ca-caliw 輪流
#e As long as I’m not dead yet, why would I stop doing what I like?
#c 如果沒有死的話，幹麻要停止呢？
#e It gratifies me to serve God; it gladdens me to serve God.
#c 侍奉神的工作是我心理所慶幸的，敬拜神讓我很快樂。
#e Now I’m alone.
#c 現在我一個人了。
#n cacay和c’cay似乎是口音的差異，目前沒有發現有意思相異之處。
#e My children are all grown-up; I have five children.
#c 小孩子們全都長大了，我有五個小孩。
#e Two daughters and three sons.
#c 二個女的，三個男的。
#e All of them have work.
#c （他們）全部都有工作了。
#e They have good jobs.
#c 他們的工作很好。
#e They are healthy.
#c 身體很健康。
#e I am satisfied.
#c 我心裡很快樂。
#e Although I live alone at home, they would return to visit me and accompany me.
#c 然而，不管（他們）在哪裡，我一個人在家休息，他們會回來探訪，跟我作伴。
#e Although I have been used to being alone,
#c 雖然現在我習慣了一個人。
#n mi-nanam「學習」，ma-nanam「習慣」。
#e My second daughter is teaching at Changbin Elementary School.
#c 我第二個女兒在長濱國小當老師。
#e She lives here to accompany me.
#c 她住在這裡和我作伴。
#e I don’t feel lonely.
#c 我的心不覺得寂寞。
#e I have now told you about the journey of my life.
#c 我那樣子述說我的人生旅程，就是如此。
